intro: Callicarpa leveilleana, commonly known as the purple beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its clusters of small, bright purple berries that appear in the fall. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is known for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and fruit. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas and can reach heights of up to 3 meters. The berries are not only visually striking but also serve as a food source for various birds and small mammals.
